title: [求文宣] 英文版《15歲少女浮屍案件》

replies.msg:
呢單野有好多唔合理既地方
好想同身邊嘅外國朋友解釋
但係英文唔好唔識講
跪求英文5以上既都幫手翻譯一下
整合下啲新聞內容 同資訊
圖又好 文字都好

replies.msg:
推 求英文好既手足幫幫手
一有文宣我會即刻放上twitter

國際戰線
呢篇係我譯既，麻煩大家幫手推上國際！

Hong Kong protestor CHAN YIN LAM (陳彥霖), aged 15, found dead naked in the sea.

9/19 Last seen by her friends in Mei Foo at 2:15pm, messaged her friends 10 min later saying that she was on her way home.
9/22 A female body was found naked in the sea near Yau Tong Devil’s peak (later confirmed to be CHAN YIN LAM). Police claimed they found a 25-30 y/o female body on that day.
9/24 Her friends posted missing person notices on the internet.
9/27 Her friends contacted her family members and learned that they were notified of her death on 9/26, and that she committed suicide by jumping into the sea.
9/28 Her friends shared the incident on Instagram, later warned by her family members not to spread words about the incident.
10/5 HK press Apple Daily journalist asked the Police about the case. Police admitted the body found on 9/22 belongs to a “15 y/o missing girl” but refused to answer other questions (Is this a suicide case? Any suspicion on the case? Was she arrested? Was the girl CHAN YIN LAM? Was CHAN arrested during the protests and taken to the Police station)
10/6 Police claimed “the case is under investigation, and they are awaiting autopsy and other test results”.
10/9 Police finally confirmed the body was indeed CHAN YIN LAM.
10/10 Police claimed that CHAN committed suicide and there is nothing suspicious about the case, and her body was already cremated.

Suspicion about the case:
1. CHAN was a frequent pretestor, it is possible that she was targeted by the Police or pro-Chinese Gov groups.
2. No suicide note was found.
3. She was a good swimmer and was in her school’s platform diving team.
4. She was found completely naked.
5. Journalists were unable to contact her family members. Her family members who did spoke about the incident were evasive and suspicious.
6. Police refused to release key CCTV footages that may explain her whereabouts during her last moments.
7. Police already cremated her body, leaving no evidence behind.
